comments.raw_text: It would be nice to add event loop info (how much time we're spending away from it, say) to telemetry...
comments.text: It would be nice to add event loop info (how much time we're spending away from it, say) to telemetry...

comments.creator: jruderman@gmail.com
comments.author: jruderman@gmail.com
comments.text: Does the code in bug 606574 help?
comments.raw_text: Does the code in bug 606574 help?

The code in bug 606574 could measure this, but it wasn't written with the intent of running in release builds on end-user systems. As written it would be terrible for power consumption, since it wakes up every 10 milliseconds to ping the event loop.

I think the code in bug 429592 would be more suited to measuring this, since it's already designed to run all the time in release builds.

comments.raw_text: I'm not sure if this is redundant with other Snappy telemetry work.  I think that has mostly focused on measuring specific sources of pauses.
comments.text: I'm not sure if this is redundant with other Snappy telemetry work.  I think that has mostly focused on measuring specific sources of pauses.
comments.creator: continuation@gmail.com
comments.author: continuation@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Andrew McCreight [:mccr8] from comment #4)
> I'm not sure if this is redundant with other Snappy telemetry work.  I think
> that has mostly focused on measuring specific sources of pauses.

I think this is highly relevant. Assigning this a P2 until we can find someone to work on this. This is not a P1 because it's not clear how this would help us improve responsiveness.
